pr_title: Core: add sort order id to content file

timeline.message: Core: add sort order id to content file interface

timeline.body: What about `withSortOrder`? Is there a case where we would only have the ID and not the `SortOrder`? Just trying to think of what will be convenient. We could always expose both methods.
timeline.bodyText: What about withSortOrder? Is there a case where we would only have the ID and not the SortOrder? Just trying to think of what will be convenient. We could always expose both methods.
timeline.bodyHTML: What about withSortOrder? Is there a case where we would only have the ID and not the SortOrder? Just trying to think of what will be convenient. We could always expose both methods.
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText:
I think if we change this to withSortOrder and store sortOrder directly, copy() of this Builder might have problem since DataFile only has sortOrderId() but no sortOrder() so we couldn't copy directly; we probably also couldn't add sortOrder() to ContentFile/DataFile since the file created from Avro reflection will not have the struct without looking up table metadata?
But if withSortOrder essentially only extracts the id and does the same thing as withSortOrderId here, then it will definitely be more convenient. I'll update to do that but please let me know if I didn't understand correctly!
